modes.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* modes.h
00002         -- header file for vibrational modes */
00003 
00004 /* Begun 20070519 by Lachele Foley
00005 This file contains structures to be used for descriptions of
00006 vibrational modes.  Most of the definitions should be obvious
00007 to most folks who are concerned with vibrations.  But, a few,
00008 like the "extent of" descriptors, will not be so evident.  
00009 Eventually, I'll document how they are determined -- they
00010 basically boil down to normalized dot products, but the exact
00011 definitions might be more subtle. */
00012 
00013 #if !defined(GLYLIB_MODES)
00014 #define GLYLIB_MODES
00015 //#include "molecules.h"
00016 
00017 typedef struct {
00018         int i; // array index
00019         int j; // internal index 
00020         int k; // some other index
00021 } intset; // intended to use in assignment arrays for indexing to mode details
00022 
00023 typedef struct {
00024         int ct; // mode class type
00025 // Class types are indexed by number, e.g.:
00026 //      0       stretch  
00027 //      1       anglebend 
00028 //      2       torsion 
00029 //      3       ringmotion
00030         int ce; // class entry ... 
00031         int i ; // other index
00032 // the index for of a certain type (e.g., stretch) in the vibmode array
00033         int C; // complexity for this mode entry
00034         double w; // weight (intensity, extent, etc.) for this mode
00035 } vibindex;
00036 
00037 typedef struct{
00038         int i; // general index
00039         int nv; // number of va's
00040         vibindex *vi; // indices for mode details
00041         molindex mi; // info about the atom
00042 } vibaddr; // for holding addresses in a vibmode array
00043 
00044 typedef struct {
00045         int i; // index
00046         char Desc[501]; // free-form description for mode 
00047         double I; // intensity of the motion (user-defined...)
00048         double e; // extent of stretch in motion
00049         molindex  A,B;
00050         coord_3D c; // e.g., for describing motions in i,j,k 
00051 } stretch; // description of stretch
00052 
00053 typedef struct {
00054         int i; // index
00055         char Desc[501]; // free-form description for mode 
00056         double I; // intensity of the motion (user-defined...)
00057         double e; // extent of angle bend in motion
00058         molindex  A,B,C; 
00059         coord_3D c; // e.g., for describing motions in i,j,k 
00060 } anglebend; // description of anglebend
00061 
00062 typedef struct {
00063         int i; // index
00064         char Desc[501]; // free-form description for mode 
00065         double I; // intensity of the motion (user-defined...)
00066         double e; // extent of torsion in motion
00067         molindex  A,B,C;
00068         coord_3D c; // e.g., for describing motions in i,j,k 
00069 } torsion; // description of torsion
00070 
00071 typedef struct {
00072         int i; // index
00073         char Desc[1001]; // free-form description for mode
00074         double I; // intensity of the motion (user-defined...)
00075         double e; // extent of ring-portion of overall motion
00076         double pvp; // motion parallel (~0) or perpendicular (~1) to plane
00077         double par; // breathing-type or side-to-side motion (if parallel)
00078         double sym; // symmetric (~1) or antisymmetric (~0) (par or perp)
00079         int symZ,symXY; // symmetries in the Z direction and XY plane
00080         int na; // number of main atoms involved
00081         molindex  *mi; //na of these
00082         int nc; // number of vectormag_3D sets 
00083         vectormag_3D *c; // nc of these (e.g., direction intensities of atoms)
00084 } ringmotion; // description of ring-related motion
00085 
00086 typedef struct {
00087         int i,j,k; // indices -- molecule number, file entry number, etc.
00088         double f; // frequency for this mode (usually in wavenumbers)
00089         double I; // intensity of mode, user-defined
00090         double IR; // IR intensity of the mode (absorption, preferrably)
00091         double RA; // RAMAN intensity of the mode (absorption, preferrably)
00092         char Desc[1001]; // free-form description
00093         int C; // complexity factor (number of different motions represented)
00094         int ns; // number of stretches in mode
00095         int na; // number of angle bends in mode
00096         int nt; // number of torsions in mode
00097         int nr; // number of ring-related motions in mode
00098         stretch *s; // stretches (ns of these)
00099         anglebend *a; // number of angle bends (na of these)
00100         torsion *t; // torsions (nt of these)
00101         ringmotion *r; // ring-related motions (nr of these)
00102         double te; // extent of translational character in mode
00103         double re; // extent of rotational character in mode
00104         vectormag_3D tv, rv, mvs; // translation vec, rotation vec, sum of motion vectors
00105         double maxmag; // maximum vector magnitude in native set
00106         double modemax; // maximum s-a-t score in mode set (used to scale vectors to max of 1)
00107         double maxmodemag; // vector magnitude for the modemax vector
00108         double maxKEmag; // for the larges s-a-t assignment, the KE along that assignment
00109 } vibmode; // description of a vibrational mode 
00110 
00111 
00112 typedef struct { // human-readable-assignment structure for two equivalent atoms
00113         int C; //complexity
00114         int ns2,na2,nt2; // for atom list with unknown symmetry
00115         intset *s2,*a2,*t2; 
00116         int ns2s;
00117         intset *s2s; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- symmetric
00118         int ns2a;
00119         intset *s2a; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- asymmetric
00120         int na2s;
00121         intset *a2s; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- symmetric
00122         int na2a;
00123         intset *a2a; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- asymmetric 
00124         int nt2s;
00125         intset *t2s; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- symmetric
00126         int nt2a;
00127         intset *t2a; // stretches with two equivalent atoms -- asymmetric
00128         double s2se,s2ae,a2se,a2ae,t2se,t2ae; // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00129 } twoassign; // description of a vibrational mode 
00130 typedef struct { // human-readable-assignment structure for two ring-related motions
00131         int C; //complexity
00132         int nopsA;
00133         intset *opsA; // Out of plane stretch (axial atoms), single atom info
00134 //      -- these point to ringmotion structures relating to the atoms above
00135         int nopss;
00136         intset  *opss; // Out of plane stretch (axial atoms) -- symmetric
00137         int nopsa;
00138         intset  *opsa; // Out of plane stretch (axial atoms) -- asymmetric
00139         double opsSe,opsPe,opsDe; // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00140         int nopdA;
00141         intset  *opdA; // Out of plane distortion (ring atoms), single atom info
00142 //      -- these point to ringmotion structures relating to the atoms above
00143         int nopdA1G;
00144         intset  *opdA1G; // Out of plane distortion (ring atoms) -- A-1-G symmetry
00145         int nopdOth;
00146         intset  *opdOth; // Out of plane distortion (ring atoms) -- some other symmetry
00147         double opdse,opdae; // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00148         int nrbA;
00149         intset  *rbA; // ring breathing motion, single atom info
00150 //      -- these point to ringmotion structures relating to the atoms above
00151         int nrbs;
00152         intset  *rbs; // ring breathing motion, symmetric
00153         int nrba;
00154         intset  *rba; // ring breathing motion, asymmetric
00155 // REGARDING O and P assignments:
00156 //      Atom A is exocyclic and bound to endocyclic B
00157 //      R is the vector for the radius from ring center to B
00158 //      T is the tangent at B, always oriented the same, e.g. (counter)clockwise
00159 //      M is the cross product of R and T (M points perpendicular to the ring plane)
00160 // If the motion vector is orthogonal to M, it is type O (moves along ring perimeter)
00161 // If the motion vector is parallel to M, it is type P (moves _|_ to ring perimeter)
00162         int nroA;
00163         intset  *roA; // ring-related O motion (not stretch), single atom info
00164 //      -- these point to ringmotion structures relating to the atoms above
00165         int nros;
00166         intset  *ros; // ring-related O motion, symmetric
00167         int nroa;
00168         intset  *roa; // ring-related O motion, asymmetric
00169         double rbAe,rbse,rbae,roAe,rose,roae;  // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00170         int nrpA;
00171         intset  *rpA; // ring-related P motion, (not breathing) single atom info
00172 //      -- these point to ringmotion structures relating to the atoms above
00173         int nrps;
00174         intset  *rps; // ring-related P motion, symmetric
00175         int nrpa;
00176         intset  *rpa; // ring-related P motion, asymmetric
00177         int nrso;
00178         intset  *rso; // other ring-related stretches
00179         double rpAe,rpse,rpae,rsoe;  // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00180 } ringassign; // description of a vibrational mode 
00181 typedef struct { // human-readable-assignment structure
00182         int i; // index
00183         int n; // index (intended as atom index for per-atom info)
00184         int loc; // location index (endocyclic, exocyclic H, etc.)
00185         char Desc[1001]; // free-form description
00186         int C; // complexity = number of motion types present 
00187 // the following pairs are the number per each and their index in an external vibmode array
00188 //      Simple motions
00189         int ns;
00190         intset *s; // plain stretches in mode 
00191         int na;
00192         intset *a; // plain angle bends in mode
00193         int nt;
00194         intset *t; // plain torsions in mode
00195         int nw;
00196         intset *w; // number of plain wags, pointers to locations
00197         int nrk;
00198         intset *rk; // number of plain rocks, pointers to locations
00199         double se,ae,te,we,rke; // these are "extents" for each of the above motions
00200 //      Motions of two coupled atoms and motions involving rings
00201         int nr, ntwo; // numbers of rings or pairs of coupled atoms
00202         ringassign *r; // ring assignment structures
00203         twoassign *two; // structures for coupled motions
00204 } assignment;
00205 
00206 typedef struct{
00207         int i,j,k; // indices
00208         molindex mi; // where this atom is
00209         double a,b,c; // numbers of interest
00210         char *Desc; // description 
00211         //intset aset,bset; // oh, why not...
00212 } assn_brief;
00213 
00214 typedef struct { // info tied to atom number
00215         int i,j; // index (to an assignment array, perhaps)
00216         double I; // normalized motion intensity for this atom (regular intensity is elsewhere)
00217         int ns, *s; // number of significant stretches, indices for those in VS
00218         int na, *a; // number of significant anglebends, indices for those in VS
00219         int nt, *t; // number of significant torsions, indices for those in VS
00220         int loc; // the location of this atom
00221 } atommode;

00223 void get_transition_intensity(molecule *M, int xl, int vl, vibmode *v, atype *ATYPE, FILE *F);
